page.title: 13RECREATION IN THE AREA
page.content: There are very few facilities in the immediate area and therefore many of the recreational activities take place in and around the home. These include knitting, sewing, gardening, reading, music and Do-it-Yourself. In addition other interests include beekeeping, ferreting, shooting and walking. There are not any public houses in the villages nor any sports clubs. The only social meeting place is the old Methodist Chapel now owned by the Women's Institute, Claxby/Normanby- le-Wold. This is used as a Polling Station at election time. Outdoor facilities for children's entertainment are also few, the main one being swings provided on a playing field on the edge of Claxby village.
